headline: Big banks report Q1 beats, China stops taking Boeing deliveries: Morning Buzz
summary: The major averages were fractionally higher near noon, adding slightly to yesterday’s gains as investors reacted to fresh headlines on U.S.-China trade tensions and a new round of corporate earnings. Markets are attempting to stabilize after a rocky stretch, but much of the tone is being shaped by President Trump’s latest tariff decisions. headline: AMD (AMD) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of computer processor maker AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) fell 7.6% in the pre-market session after chip tool maker ASML posted weak bookings (a key demand indicator) which fell below Wall Street's expectations, noting that tariffs had made the industry's outlook more uncertain.

raw.headline: AMD (AMD) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nvidia, AMD, ASML, United, Tesla, Abbott Labs, Travelers, Interactive Brokers, and More
summary: Nvidia discloses that sales of its H20 chips to China would require a license ‘for the indefinite future’ from the U.S. Department of Commerce, AMD says a license requirement for chip exports will result in charges of up to $800 million, and ASML issues disappointing sales guidance.

headline: US export controls will cost Nvidia & AMD, ASML orders miss
summary: As part of today's Market Minute, Madison Mills examines some of the trending tickers. Nvidia (NVDA) falls after reporting new export controls will cost the company $5.5 billion. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is also under pressure as the chip trade restrictions translate to a $800 million charge for the company. ASML (ASML) falls after reporting earnings, showing first quarter orders missed estimates, fueling concerns about demand during tariff uncertainty. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: 'What about Q1 earnings?' US-China trade war weighs on chip stocks
summary: US-China trade war tensions drag US stocks lower after Nvidia (NVDA) reported restrictions on exports to China would cost the chipmaker $5.5 billion. CFRA Research chief investment strategist Sam Stovall joins Morning Brief with Madison Mills and Brad Smith to discuss what the uncertainty means for first quarter earnings and chipmakers' outlooks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: AMD flags $800 million hit from new US curbs on chip exports to China
summary: Larger rival Nvidia said on Tuesday it would take $5.5 billion in charges as the export restrictions further shackle chipmakers' ability to service one of their largest markets, at a time when tit-for-tat tariffs have clouded the outlook for the sector.  Shares of both AMD and Nvidia slumped more than 5% as the restrictions battered global tech stocks.  AMD confirmed on Wednesday that the export control applies to its MI308 products.

raw.headline: AMD flags $800 million hit from new US curbs on chip exports to China
raw.summary: Larger rival Nvidia said on Tuesday it would take $5.5 billion in charges as the export restrictions further shackle chipmakers' ability to service one of their largest markets, at a time when tit-for-tat tariffs have clouded the outlook for the sector.  Shares of both AMD and Nvidia slumped more than 5% as the restrictions battered global tech stocks.  AMD confirmed on Wednesday that the export control applies to its MI308 products.

headline: AMD Warns of $800 Million Hit From Curbs on Chip Exports
summary: Advanced Micro Devices expects a hefty financial hit from new U.S. controls on AI chip exports to China, saying it could book charges of up to $800 million. Export restrictions applied to its MI308 chips could trigger charges in inventory, purchase commitments and related reserves, it said.

raw.headline: AMD Warns of $800 Million Hit From Curbs on Chip Exports
raw.summary: Advanced Micro Devices expects a hefty financial hit from new U.S. controls on AI chip exports to China, saying it could book charges of up to $800 million. Export restrictions applied to its MI308 chips could trigger charges in inventory, purchase commitments and related reserves, it said.

headline: ASML orders miss, Tesla & China, AMD $800M hit: Trending Tickers
summary: Madison Mills and Brad Smith take a closer look at some of today's trending tickers. ASML (ASML) stock is falling after the company's first quarter orders missed Wall Street's expectations, fueling fears that tariff uncertainty may hit demand. Tesla (TSLA) halts shipments of parts from China, according to reports from Reuters. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) expects an $800 million hit from the US controls on exports to China. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: U.S. Confirms New Export Curbs on Nvidia and AMD Chips
summary: The U.S. government said it would require export licenses for some artificial-intelligence chips made by Nvidia and AMD.  “The Commerce Department is issuing new export licensing requirements on the NVIDIA H20, AMD MI308, and their equivalents," the department said.  Nvidia warned late Tuesday it would take a $5.5 billion charge after the U.S. said it will need a license to export H20 processors to China and other countries.

raw.headline: U.S. Confirms New Export Curbs on Nvidia and AMD Chips
raw.summary: The U.S. government said it would require export licenses for some artificial-intelligence chips made by Nvidia and AMD.  “The Commerce Department is issuing new export licensing requirements on the NVIDIA H20, AMD MI308, and their equivalents," the department said.  Nvidia warned late Tuesday it would take a $5.5 billion charge after the U.S. said it will need a license to export H20 processors to China and other countries.

headline: Should You Buy Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Stock Before May 6?
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) supplies some of the world's best semiconductors, including a growing portfolio of chips specifically designed to handle artificial intelligence (AI) workloads in data centers and personal computers.  Investors can expect to learn more about the company's progress, and perhaps even receive an updated forecast from CEO Lisa Su regarding AI chip sales for 2025.  AMD launched its MI300X AI graphics processing unit (GPU) for the data center in late 2023.
